remarks: We call a class "untanged" if all its members are not members of themselves.  The term originates from Isbell (see citation in ~ dfon2 ).  Using this concept, we can avoid a lot of the uses of the Axiom of Regularity.  Here, we prove a series of properties of untanged classes.  First, we prove that an untangled class is not a member of itself.  (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 28-Feb-2011.)
statement:
untelirr $p |- ( A. x e. A -. x e. x -> -. A e. A ) $.
$d A x $.
